schema.title: Config
schema.description:
A configuration item which may be stored in various places, eg as `bacon.toml`
along a `Cargo.toml` file or as `prefs.toml` in the xdg config directory.

Leaf values are options (and not Default) so that they don't
override previously set values when applied to settings.

additional_alias_args.description: Extra arguments appended when a job runs a cargo alias.

allow_failures.description:
Whether to consider that we can have a success
when we have test failures

allow_warnings.description:
Whether to consider that we can have a success
when we have warnings. This is especially useful
for "cargo run" jobs

analyzer.description:
The analyzer interpreting the output of the command, the
standard cargo dedicated one if not provided

apply_gitignore.description: Whether gitignore rules must be applied

background.description:
Whether to wait for the computation to finish before
to display it on screen

This is true by default. Set it to false if you want
the previous computation result to be replaced with
the new one as soon as it starts.

command.description:
The tokens making the command to execute (first one
is the executable).

default_job.description: Name of the job to run when no job was requested explicitly.

default_watch.description:
Whether to apply the default watch list, which is
`["src", "tests", "benches", "examples", "build.rs"]`

This is true by default. Set it to false if you want
to watch nothing, or only the directories you set in
`watch`.

env.description: Env vars to set for this job execution

expand_env_vars.description: Whether to expand environment variables in the command

export.description: Deprecated single export configuration; use `exports.locations` instead.

export_locations.description: Deprecated toggle for the legacy locations export; use `exports.locations.auto`

exports.description: Export configurations keyed by their name.

extraneous_args.description:
Whether to insert extraneous arguments provided by bacon or end users

Eg: --all-features or anything after -- in bacon incantation

grace_period.description: Minimum delay to wait before restarting the job after a change is detected.

help_line.description: Whether to display the contextual help line

ignore.description: A list of glob patterns to ignore

ignored_lines.description:
Patterns of lines which should be ignored. Patterns of
the prefs or bacon.toml can be overridden at the job

jobs.description: Job definitions keyed by their identifier

keybindings.description: Custom keybindings layered on top of the defaults

kill.description: A kill command. If not provided, SIGKILL is used.

listen.description: Whether to listen for actions on a unix socket (if on unix)

need_stdout.description:
Whether we need to capture stdout too (stderr is
always captured)

on_change_strategy.description:
How to handle changes: either immediately kill the current job
then restart it, or wait for the current job to finish before
restarting it.

on_failure.description: The optional action to run when it's not a success

on_success.description:
The optional action to run when there's no
error, warning or test failures
(depending on whether `allow_warnings` is `true` or `false`)

Could be made a vec in the future but that would involve
explaining subtleties like the fact that those actions stop
after the first one ending the mission or doing a refresh

reverse.description: Whether to display the mission output in reverse order.

show_changes_count.description: Whether to display how many files triggered the current run.

skin.description: Color overrides applied to the UI while the job runs.

summary.description: Whether to show diagnostics summarized instead of full

vim_keys.description: Deprecated toggle that enables a built-in set of Vim-style keybindings. Use `keybindings` instead

watch.description:
A list of directories that will be watched if the job
is run on a package.
src, examples, tests, and benches are implicitly included
unless you `set default_watch` to false.

workdir.description:
An optional working directory for the job command, which
would override the package directory.

AnalyzerRef.description:
A stateless operator building a report from a list of command output lines.

Implementation routing will probably change at some point

BaconSkin.description: Collection of optional color overrides for the Bacon UI.

change_badge_bg.description: Background color of the change badge

change_badge_fg.description: Foreground color of the change badge

command_error_badge_bg.description: Background color of the command-error badge

command_error_badge_fg.description: Foreground color of the command-error badge

dismissed_badge_bg.description: Background color of the dismissed badge

dismissed_badge_fg.description: Foreground color of the dismissed badge

errors_badge_bg.description: Background color of the errors badge

errors_badge_fg.description: Foreground color of the errors badge

found_selected_bg.description: Background color of the selected search match

job_label_badge_bg.description: Background color of the job label badge

job_label_badge_fg.description: Foreground color of the job label badge

key_fg.description: Foreground color used for key shortcuts in the UI

menu_item_bg.description: Background color of individual menu items

menu_item_selected_bg.description: Background color of the selected menu item

menu_item_selected_fg.description: Foreground color of the selected menu item

project_name_badge_bg.description: Background color of the project name badge

project_name_badge_fg.description: Foreground color of the project name badge

search_input_prefix_fg.description: Foreground color of the '/' search prefix

search_summary_fg.description: Foreground color of the search summary

status_bg.description: Background color of the status line

status_fg.description: Foreground color of the status line

status_key_fg.description: Foreground color for key shortcuts displayed in the status line

test_fails_badge_bg.description: Background color of the failing-tests badge

test_fails_badge_fg.description: Foreground color of the failing-tests badge

test_pass_badge_bg.description: Background color of the passing-tests badge

test_pass_badge_fg.description: Foreground color of the passing-tests badge

warnings_badge_bg.description: Background color of the warnings badge

warnings_badge_fg.description: Foreground color of the warnings badge

DefaultingChangeBadgeBg.description:
Background color of the change badge
 - default value: 6

DefaultingChangeBadgeFg.description:
Foreground color of the change badge
 - default value: 235

DefaultingCommandErrorBadgeBg.description:
Background color of the command-error badge
 - default value: 9

DefaultingCommandErrorBadgeFg.description:
Foreground color of the command-error badge
 - default value: 235

DefaultingComputingBg.description:
Background color of the "computing..." indicator
 - default value: 204

DefaultingComputingFg.description:
Foreground color of the "computing..." indicator
 - default value: 235

DefaultingDismissedBadgeBg.description:
Background color of the dismissed badge
 - default value: 6

DefaultingDismissedBadgeFg.description:
Foreground color of the dismissed badge
 - default value: 235

DefaultingErrorsBadgeBg.description:
Background color of the errors badge
 - default value: 9

DefaultingErrorsBadgeFg.description:
Foreground color of the errors badge
 - default value: 235

DefaultingFoundFg.description:
Foreground color of search matches
 - default value: 208

DefaultingFoundSelectedBg.description:
Background color of the selected search match
 - default value: 208

DefaultingJobLabelBadgeBg.description:
Background color of the job label badge
 - default value: 204

DefaultingJobLabelBadgeFg.description:
Foreground color of the job label badge
 - default value: 235

DefaultingKeyFg.description:
Foreground color used for key shortcuts in the UI
 - default value: 204

DefaultingMenuBg.description:
Background color used for menus
 - default value: 235

DefaultingMenuBorder.description:
Border color used for menus
 - default value: 234

DefaultingMenuItemBg.description:
Background color of individual menu items
 - default value: 235

DefaultingMenuItemFg.description:
Foreground color of menu items
 - default value: 250

DefaultingMenuItemSelectedBg.description:
Background color of the selected menu item
 - default value: 239

DefaultingMenuItemSelectedFg.description:
Foreground color of the selected menu item
 - default value: 255

DefaultingProjectNameBadgeBg.description:
Background color of the project name badge
 - default value: 240

DefaultingProjectNameBadgeFg.description:
Foreground color of the project name badge
 - default value: 255

DefaultingSearchInputPrefixFg.description:
Foreground color of the '/' search prefix
 - default value: 208

DefaultingSearchSummaryFg.description:
Foreground color of the search summary
 - default value: 208

DefaultingStatusBg.description:
Background color of the status line
 - default value: 239

DefaultingStatusFg.description:
Foreground color of the status line
 - default value: 252

DefaultingStatusKeyFg.description:
Foreground color for key shortcuts displayed in the status line
 - default value: 204

DefaultingTestFailsBadgeBg.description:
Background color of the failing-tests badge
 - default value: 208

DefaultingTestFailsBadgeFg.description:
Foreground color of the failing-tests badge
 - default value: 235

DefaultingTestPassBadgeBg.description:
Background color of the passing-tests badge
 - default value: 2

DefaultingTestPassBadgeFg.description:
Foreground color of the passing-tests badge
 - default value: 254

DefaultingWarningsBadgeBg.description:
Background color of the warnings badge
 - default value: 11

DefaultingWarningsBadgeFg.description:
Foreground color of the warnings badge
 - default value: 235

ExportConfig.description: A generic configuration for all exports, whatever the exporter.

auto.description: Whether the export should run automatically after each mission.

exporter.description: Exporter backend that should produce the output.

line_format.description: Optional format string used by exporters that write line-based data.

path.description: Destination path where the exporter writes its output.

oneOf.description:
The analyzer is tasked with doing an export while analyzing the
command output
This exporter doesn't exist at the moment
Emit a machine-readable JSON report for the mission.
Produce a list of file locations for editors or other tools.

Job.description: One of the possible jobs that bacon can run

allow_failures.description:
Whether to consider that we can have a success
when we have test failures

allow_warnings.description:
Whether to consider that we can have a success
when we have warnings. This is especially useful
for "cargo run" jobs

analyzer.description:
The analyzer interpreting the output of the command, the
standard cargo dedicated one if not provided

background.description:

is the executable).

expand_env_vars.description: Whether to expand environment variables in the command

Eg: --all-features or anything after -- in bacon incantation

How to handle changes: either immediately kill the current job

on_failure.description: The optional action to run when it's not a success

on_success.description:
The optional action to run when there's no

show_changes_count.description: Whether to display how many files triggered the current run.

skin.description: Color overrides applied to the UI while the job runs.

watch.description:
A list of directories that will be watched if the job

src, examples, tests, and benches are implicitly included

workdir.description:
An optional working directory for the job command, which

KeyBindings.description: Mapping from key combinations to actions.

OnChangeStrategy.description: Strategy to apply when changes are detected while a job is running.

oneOf.description: Stop the running job immediately before starting a new one.
Let the running job finish before starting again.

base_volume.description: Base volume, acting as a multiplier for the volume of specific sounds.

enabled.description: Whether sound notifications should be played.
